channel.title: BBC News - World

item.title: Afghanistan war: Taliban capture regional capital Zaranj
item.description: Officials say the insurgents took the southern city of Zaranj, in a big blow to government forces.

item.title: Mercer Street: Tanker blast evidence points to Iran, says US
item.description: The attack on the Israeli-operated merchant tanker last week killed two people.

item.title: Greece fires spread uncontrolled, killing a fireman
item.description: Thousands of people are being evacuated as uncontrolled fires continue to rage.

item.title: Families of 9/11 victims tell Biden not to attend memorial events
item.description: Relatives of the 2001 terror attack victims say Mr Biden must declassify what role Saudi Arabia had.

item.title: Jennifer Aniston explains cutting off unvaccinated friends
item.description: The Friends actor has elaborated on why she has "lost a few people" who have refused the jab.

item.title: Dixie Fire: California town decimated by largest active US blaze
item.description: The US' largest active fire warped street lights and destroyed the town of Greenville, California.

item.title: Snickers Spain pulls TV advert after homophobia accusations
item.description: The brand apologises for a "misunderstanding" after its Spanish commercial was heavily criticised.

item.title: Two arrested over plot to kill Myanmar UN ambassador
item.description: Ambassador Kyaw Moe Tun is a vocal critic of Myanmar's junta, which seized power in a coup on 1 February.

item.title: US expands citizenship for children born abroad in win for same-sex couples
item.description: Children born through surrogacy or IVF can now qualify, even without being related to the US parent.

item.title: CNN fires unvaccinated employees for going to office
item.description: The network is among several US firms to require employees working with others to be vaccinated.

item.title: Covid: Italy rolls out 'green pass' for public venue access
item.description: All those aged 12 and over with at least one jab will be able to access bars, cinemas and gyms.

item.title: Eurovision, Euro 2020 and Tokyo 2020 Olympics - Italy's golden summer
item.description: "This is Italy's moment of glory" - after Eurovision & Euro 2020 victories, an Italian Wimbledon finalist, now comes Olympics history in Tokyo.

item.title: Mozambique insurgency: Rwanda leads the fightback
item.description: A 1,000-strong force has made major gains against the insurgents since its deployment last month.

item.title: Indian women's hockey: Sixteen stories of struggle, one tale of triumph
item.description: Fighting until the very end, India go down 3-4 to Great Britain in the bronze medal playoff.

item.title: Africa's week in pictures: 30 July-5 August 2021
item.description: A selection of the best photos from Africa's week dominated by the Olympics.

item.title: COP26: What is the UN climate conference in Glasgow and why is it so important?
item.description: The annual climate change summit is being held in Glasgow - who's going and what's at stake?

item.title: Afghan interpreter: 'A better life for my wife and children in the UK'
item.description: Afghan interpreters who worked with British forces are being relocated to the UK, as the Taliban advance.

item.title: Sharks from above: Filming 'friendly' encounters in Sydney
item.description: Jason Iggleden captures stunning moments in Sydney, often helping to reduce people's fear.

item.title: Will Turkey's bees return after the wildfires?
item.description: Residents of Marmaris, Turkey, are mourning their bees and honey, lost to fires.

item.title: Tankus the Henge: Touring in France post-Brexit 'a puzzle'
item.description: Band Tankus the Henge negotiates touring in France, their first trip there since Brexit rules were imposed.

item.title: Afghanistan: Mother of British soldier anger at war
item.description: Nathalie's son Cpl Jake Hartley was killed while serving in Helmand in 2012.

item.title: Telfar Clemens: Designer creates Tokyo 2020 Olympic outfits for Team Liberia
item.description: American-Liberian designer Telfar Clemens created Liberian team's outfits at the Tokyo Olympics.

item.title: Allyson Felix sets record with 10th medal
item.description: American Allyson Felix becomes the most decorated female track and field athlete of all time by taking 400m bronze for her 10th Olympic medal.

item.title: Kenny first GB woman to win gold at three games
item.description: Laura Kenny and Katie Archibald win Olympic madison gold before Jack Carlin wins sprint bronze.

item.title: China: Backlash over marriage question in Olympian's interview
item.description: Chinese athlete Gong Lijiao was asked about her marriage plans and described as a "manly woman".

item.title: Teenager Quan sets record to win women's diving gold
item.description: Chinese diver Quan Hongchan, 14, sets a new world record to beat 15-year-old Chen Yuxi and win women's diving 10m platform gold.

item.title: Elaine Thompson-Herah: Instagram blocks gold medallist who shared race win
item.description: The Jamaican sprinter was blocked after posting footage of her races on her Instagram account.
